Class CardGame

java.lang.Object
CardGame
public class CardGame extends Object
A card game that utilises threads, where each player (thread) draws a card from the deck to their left and discards one to the deck on their right, whoever has four cards of the same numerical value in their hand wins.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Kamran Haque, Tyler Allen

    • readPack

      public boolean readPack(String path, int numPlayers)
      A method which takes the path of the pack, then reads the lines of the file as integers to create new Card objects.
      Parameters:
      path - The location of the text file as a String.
      numPlayers - The number of players.
      Returns:
      True if pack is valid, false if pack is invalid.

    • distributeCards

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<Card>> distributeCards(int numPlayers)
      A method to distribute the cards among the hands and decks.
      Parameters:
      numPlayers - The number of players.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of player hands.

    • setUpGame

      public boolean setUpGame(String path, int numPlayers)
      A method which sets up the card game, reads the pack, creates the hands and decks, distributes the cards and initialises the player threads.
      Parameters:
      path - The location of the text file as a String.
      numPlayers - The number of players.
      Returns:
      True if pack is valid, false if pack is invalid.

    • notifyAllFinished

      public void notifyAllFinished(int id)
      Method to interrupt all threads once a thread has won and output deck contents.
      Parameters:
      id - Id of winning player.

      Starts the player threads.
